title: Introducing MSVC AddressSanitizer for ARM64 targets
description:
We are pleased to announceÂ AddressSanitizerÂ (ASan) support for the Microsoft C++ (MSVC) Build Tools forÂ ARM64 targets.Â ASan is a runtime memory error detector thatÂ identifiesÂ difficult-to-find bugs with zero false positives and improves memory safety.Â More technical information on ASan can be found atÂ aka.ms/asan.Â  ASan has long supported the x64 and x86 architectures. With theÂ release of Visual Studio 2026 for [â€¦]
The post Introducing MSVC AddressSanitizer for ARM64 targets appeared first on C++ Team Blog.
creator: Zachary Johnson

title: Why Diffusion Models Could Change Developer Workflows in 2026
description: Developers spend much of their time editing, refactoring, and debugging rather than producing entirely new code. Code creation tends to involve non-sequential back-and-forth refinement rather than typing out a complete function in one uninterrupted sequence. You might sketch a part, adjust parameters, skip ahead, then revisit earlier sections to refine them.Â  Diffusion models, and in [â€¦]
creator: Damian Bogunowicz

title: Efficient Optimization With Ax, an Open Platform for Adaptive Experimentation
description:
Weâ€™ve releasedÂ Ax 1.0, an open-source platform that uses machine learning to automatically guide complex, resource-intensive experimentation. Ax is used at scale across Meta to improve AI models, tune production infrastructure, and accelerate advances in ML and even hardware design. Our accompanying paper, â€œAx: A Platform for Adaptive Experimentationâ€ explains Axâ€™s architecture, methodology, and how it [...]

title: Azure MCP Server Now Built-In with Visual Studio 2026: A New Era for Agentic Workflows
description:
Managing cloud resources often means juggling multiple tools, writing custom scripts, and switching contexts between your IDE and cloud management portals. These extra steps slow development and make it harder to build intelligent, secure applications efficiently. Weâ€™re excited to announce that Azure MCP Server (Model Context Protocol) tools are now generally available out-of-the-box in Visual [â€¦]
